thread.title: Prep roundup: St. Charles North volleyball wins Saxon Invite
thread.title_full: Prep roundup: St. Charles North volleyball wins Saxon Invite

title: Prep roundup: St. Charles North volleyball wins Saxon Invite
text:
Prep roundup: St. Charles North volleyball wins Saxon Invite Published: Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015 5:35 p.m. CDT By KANE COUNTY CHRONICLE 
SCHAUMBURG â€“ The St. Charles North girls volleyball is starting to realize that a hot start wasn't just going to last at the beginning of the season. 
Daley Krage and Claire Anderson led the offensive attack as the North Stars went 5-0, including a 25-22, 25-23 victory over Cary-Grove in the championship to win the Schaumburg Saxon Invite. 
North (25-3) beat East Peoria, Bartlett and Hononegah in pool, before defeating St. Viator, 25-15, 25-19, in the semifinals. 
Krage tallied 33 kills, 11 aces and 12 digs, while Anderson finished the tournament with 39 kills, three aces and nine digs. Sam Lappin's 33 digs were also team-high during the weekend's matches. 
The North Stars will host Elgin on Tuesday for their senior night. 
BOYS SOCCER 
St. Charles East 4, South Elgin 1: At St. Charles, Evan DiLeonardi scored two goals, while Mitch Dorsey and Zach Nelson added one each for 11-5-4 St. Charles East in the Upstate Eight Conference crossover match. 
Streamwood 4, St. Charles North 3: At Bridgeview, St. Charles North suffered its first loss of the UEC River Division season to Streamwood at Toyota Park. Dylan Mientus, Alex Amro and Matt McCullough scored goals for the North Stars (12-3-3, 4-1 UEC River), who are now tied with St. Charles East for the River lead, but hold the head-to-head tiebreaker. 
Burlington Central 2, Dixon 0: At Dixon, Jack Schramme scored his 18th and 19th goals of the season to lead 10-9-1 Burlington Central past Dixon in the nonconference matchup. 
CROSS-COUNTRY 
West Aurora Invite: At Aurora, the Batavia girls team took second overall (46 points), behind meet winner Yorkville (33). Batavia's Emma Stephens took first overall, running a 17:10.06, while Dakota Roman finished in third (17:35.50). 
St. Charles East (173) took fourth place as a team, and its top finisher was Anatasia Honea, who finished in 17:54.70, while Madison Ronzone helped Rosary take ninth overall with her fourth place overall finish (17:37.29) in the 17-team meet. 
On the boys side, Batavia's Shea Bastian finished sixth overall (15:39.57) to help Batavia earn 156 points, which was sixth out of 14 teams. Bo Ruttens (16:02.93) and Jose Rangel (16:05.95) finished 23rd and 24th overall for St. Charles North as the North Stars (188) finished eighth as a team behind meet winner Yorkville (89). 
Dan Heineman (16:21.47) was Marmion's top finisher for a tenth place Cadets squad. 
Sterling Invite: At Sterling, Carly Bartholomew was Kaneland girls cross-country's top finisher with a 20:27, which helped the Knights to 16th place in the 21-team invite.
